result.execSummary:
The defendant CHRISTOPHER L MCCLOUD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Court grants the defendant 68 days jail credit.
- Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER L MCCLOUD in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Def would like to plead NO CONTEST to the charge. ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. ADA recites offer - upon plea, will recommend fine and costs and DNA sample. 

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 striking the domestic and repeater. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA McElroy. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-68 days in jail. Court grants def 68 days jail credit.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 10:34 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:13 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER L MCCLOUD in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA states that the victim requested notice and has not been able to get a hold of the victim. Court makes statement to the defendant.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 AM

Court adjourned at 9:15 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Inmate Request to the Court
Status hearing on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:53 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER L MCCLOUD in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he qualifies for PD representation and requests to represent himself. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Statement by the Court regarding felony. Statement by defendant - is no longer a felony. Court sets for Status Hearing on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Statement by defendant, thought the case would be resolved today. Statement by DA Laspisa. Further statement by DA - will have the ADA set up a meeting with the defendant.

Court adjourned at 10:57 AM
Status hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD: 

Defendant CHRISTOPHER L MCCLOUD in court, in custody and without counsel.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court sets for status hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:30 a.m. If defendant is still in custody and not on a PO hold, Court will look at addressing bond.
No violent contact with the victim.
Status hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:28 PM Defendant CHRISTOPHER L MCCLOUD in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court cancels the preliminary hearing. Defendant has received a copy of the amended criminal complaint and waives reading. Court finds probable cause. Statement by defendant, would like to go to sentencing today and will waive right to counsel. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Statement by ADA re: victim witness rights, attempted to contact the victim last week. Further statement by ADA - has not made an offer as of yet. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court orders $150 cash bond and No Violent Contact with the victim. Court sets for Stratus Hearing on June 22, 2022 at 1:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 1:35 PM

No Contact with the victim - EC. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

1:12 PM Defendant CHRISTOPHER L MCCLOUD appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Statement by ADA re: bond, makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victim - EC. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim on June 20, 2022 at 1:00 PM and for Preliminary Hearing on June 21, 2022 at 8:45 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:17 PM
